result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Patrick Roling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall report on or before September 9, 2022, at 6 pm.
Huber and transfer to Vernon County granted.
Concurrent with: 21CF202
All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven Patrick Roling in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Steven Patrick Roling. Per agreement, defendant to plead to charge. State will remain silent as to sentence. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard on prior convictions. Attorney Mickelson heard and recommends 5 years probation with conditional jail. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 1 year jail with huber, concurrent. Report by 6 pm on September 9, 2022. Transfer to Vernon County granted. Defendant to pay court costs and submit DNA sample. Credit of 57 days.
Notice of Hearing

Defendant Steven Patrick Roling not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Steven Patrick Roling. Defendant sent text through wifi that he has no phone and cannot appear today. Attorney Mickelson expects a resolution. Court authorizes warrant but will not sign until August 16, 2022, to see if defendant appears.

records.addlTxt: Granting Motion to Withdraw as Appointed Counsel
Status conference on July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, in custody at Lafayette County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Steven Patrick Roling. Defendant is requesting new counsel. Court heard on motion. Defendant heard. Attorney Zaleski heard on motion. Court grants Attorney Zaleski's motion to withdraw. Defendant to contact SPD to get a new attorney appointed. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Motion hearing on May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

If you are unable to join by internet using video, you may join the hearing by phone by calling 1-312-626-6799 (meeting ID: 600-348-151). If you wish to appear in person, please contact Judge VanDeHey's Judicial Assistant at (608) 723-7826.

preliminary hearing & arraignment--Defendant Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, in custody from Crawford County Jail, Attorney Steven W. Zaleski for Steven Patrick Roling appeared by video, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Zaleski has been appointed. State heard and requests $500 cash bond. Attorney Zaleski heard. Court heard and sets bond at $250 cash. Attorney Zaleski is ready to proceed with preliminary hearing. Court finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his right to preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause to bind over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives formal reading and stand mute. Court enters not guilty pleas on his behalf. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on April 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
